The Analysis

After filtering out 967 CSV republication artifacts (where quarterly data overlap causes apparent duplicates), our system identified 183 high-confidence duplicate payment groups totalling £73,000.

A further 408 medium-confidence groups totalling £95,400 were flagged — these are same supplier, same amount, same day payments with different reference numbers that could be either genuine duplicates or legitimate repeat payments.

Context

Chorley's duplicate rate is relatively low compared to other Lancashire councils when measured against total spend. At £73K in high-confidence duplicates against £330.9M total spend, the duplicate rate is approximately 0.02%.

However, even small percentages of a large budget represent real money. The combined £168,400 in flagged payments could fund community programmes, park maintenance, or other resident-facing services.

View the evidence on our Spending page.
